My research centers on developing and applying statistical methods to better understand complex ecological and environmental systems. I am especially interested in geospatial data analysis, non-parametric methods, and Bayesian modeling, which provide powerful tools for capturing spatial structure and uncertainty in ecological processes. My work often engages with real-world data from environmental and agricultural contexts, where flexible modeling and thoughtful inference are essential. 

I am currently working with [Dr. Jarad Niemi](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jarad/cv/master/JaradNiemi-CV.pdf) for my Ph.D.
